solution.text:
TSA of the bucket= CSA of the frustum + area of the base of the bucket
CSA of a frustum of a cone is \(\pi \times l \times [r+R] \) where \(l=\sqrt {h^2+(R^2-r^2)}\)
putting the values, \(h=_{{4*j}}_,r=_{j}_,R=_{{4*j}}_\)
we get,\(\frac {22}7 \times (_{j}_+_{{4*j}}_) \times \sqrt {_{{4*j}}_^2+[_{{4*j}}_^2 - _{j}_^2]} \)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*5*j*5*j,2)}}_\)
area of the bottom face=\(\pi \times r^2= _{{trunc(j*j*pi_val,2)}}_\)
Therefore , TSA\(=_{{trunc(j*j*pi_val,2)}}_+_{{trunc(pi_val*5*j*5*j,2)}}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*(5*j*5*j+j*j),2)}}_\)
cost of the sheet= TSA Bucket\(\times \) rate = _{{trunc(pi_val*(5*j*5*j+j*j),2)}}_\(\times \)_{l}_
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*(5*j*5*j+j*j)*l,2)}}_\)

content.text:
A bucket is in the shape of a frustum of a cone having the radius of its two circular faces as _{j}_ cm and _{{4*j}}_ cm and the vertical height of the bucket is _{{4*j}}_ cm
If the rate of the metal sheet is _{l}_ \(Rs/cm^2\), find the total cost of the sheet required to manufacture the bucket
